intro: Heracleum marashicum, commonly known as the Caucasian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and large, fern-like leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in umbrella-shaped clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
